name: Shorebreak Hotel, a Joie de Vivre Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Shorebreak April 24-27. My husband and I were celebrating our 30th anniversary and had dicided to combine a vacation with visiting our daughter, a student at Cal State Fullerton. A pleasant surprise to us was that she decided at the last minute to stay with us while we were there. We weren't sure if that would work spacewise however. Upon check-in, the young man at the front desk upgraded our room to a suite at no additional charge. He could not have been nicer and as we were the only ones at the front desk at that time, the young man working next to him was a lot of fun also. Told us about the wine reception and activities in the area.
reviews.title: Great staff...great room...great location!

reviews.text: The room was great. I was worried at first because the room was immediately over the bar/patio area. They had live music that night. The good news is that it did not bother us. We could hear it with our windows open, and feel it a little from reverbations, but it was all over by 10:30 and totally quiet after that. I might change the lightbulbs to be a little brighter as it was dim in the evening. Our daughter was working on a paper and it was hard for her to read. Comfy bed. And everytime we entered the room, it smelled wonderful. Shower with no door didn't bother us and it was not too wet...we have a walk-in shower at home. Pitiful blow dryer. Bath products smelled wonderful.
reviews.title: We were litterally blown away by cigarette smoke and rude desk clerks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed appetizers, drinks and breakfast in the restaurant, and the food was excellent...especially the appetizers....I did think $12 for my mudslide was a little over the top. It was ok, not great. No ice cream, not frozen.
reviews.title: closest place to home!

reviews.text: Day two introduced us to the two girls working at the front desk...Jessie and Amber, I believe. Both were great and very helpful. When we wanted to arrange beach chairs for the beach, they set it up and offered us the use of chairs that other guests had left behind. That evening, the internet connection in the room didn't work. They sent the engineer immediately...couldn't have been nicer, but couldn't fix it....had us call number for the technology service and after 45 minutes and working up to level 3, I am not sure what happened, but it started to work. Woo hoo! Our daughter was stressing over her ability to research her paper.
reviews.title: As good as it gets!
Really Great Again
reviews.text: The only thing I missed is a pool. It was not real warm, and somewhat windy which made the beach chillier and too cold to lay out. That courtyard with the windbreak all around would be the perfect area!

I was very impressed with the hotel during my stay a year ago. Spent a few days in California to break up a couple of weeks in Vegas and chose this hotel due to its location by the beach, and used as a hub to drive around California a bit. Was quite expensive for our two night stay but this is one for the best hotels (in general) I have every stayed in. Rooms are small but have everything you need and the bathrooms (tubs especially are incredible). The onsite restaurant was good and all the staff were very helpful and courteous. Planning on staying here again when I return next year.
reviews.title: Better than i ever could have imagined

reviews.text: I sought a 2day getaway and wow, did I receive it! Not only did this darling fun town welcome me, it wouldn't have been complete without this hotel! The staff has redefined for me the meaning of customer service!! From the woman I booked my reservations through, to the valet staff, to the amazing lobby hosts, I felt as if I was the only one is this hotel! I was upgraded to a room situated sweetly over the store lined street with a beautiful view of the pier! Each night my room being lit with the sparkly lights and the soft sounds of the restaurant below. I was new to the town and each question I asked was met with such generosity! It was like having my own personal tour guides all wrapped up in one beautiful package. The wine hour is fantastic, newspaper service is wonderful and the convenience of being situated so close to all within walking distance was priceless. Ive never had my expectations exceeded as I did on this getaway!
reviews.title: Made to feel as if I was the only one in the hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the look of the hotel upon entering the lobby. Very hip and energetic, yet comfortable for the whole family, even your pets. We were given wine as we went to check out our enormous ocean view room. Great bed, great shower and general feel. All employees were unbelievably warm, friendly and helpful. The service at the restaurant, Zimzala, was superb and the food was relatively inexpensive and high quality. My only constructive feedback is that the hotel should spring for movies on demand. Call me crazy because we were across from the Pacific Ocean, but I still would have liked to have a pool and hot tub. Stay here. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: A hotel that combines hip and family

reviews.text: What can I say? This place has it all: GREAT Staff (probably the nicest staff I've run into in a very very long time), Great location, Great food and drinks, Great rooms, it has it all.
reviews.title: You can't beat this place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there of the 4th of July weekend. Parade in front of hotel, which was an added bonus. Beign right across teh street from the beach is best. Not too many places in Southern California can claim this fact.
reviews.title: Great service and a great location!

reviews.text: I took my sons and a friend down to Huntington Beach for a few days before school started. We previously lived in Huntington Beach and enjoy the downtown area and beaches. Prior to the Shorebreak Hotel opening there were no close hotels to this area. We found the Shorebreak Hotel and wanted to give it a try. It sits on top of shops just off the main street on the second through fourth floors. We had a view of the pier and really enjoyed the room and bathroom.
reviews.title: Right in the heart of Huntington Beach

reviews.text: The bathroom is as big as the room and has a wonderful bath tub and walk-in shower. The beds in the room were comfortable and the down pillows topped of the bed. The only downside is that we wanted to sleep with the window open but it is downtown and there was some activity in the morning on Friday. Housekeeping was a little lax, we found some trash on the floor of the bathroom and bedroom, clothing tags and a food wrapper. I did have to call housekeeping one afternoon after our room was cleaned and ask for more shampoo and soap. The front desk was very responsive and they were delivered within 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Amazing spot in the heart of Huntington Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this is a great location to walk to everything, the beach, restaurants and shopping. Every afternoon at 5:00 PM they had a wine tasting and a realy nice restaurant/bar. I liked the relaxed atmosphere and decor of the hotel, you could walk out to the beach in a bathing suit and thongs and not feel out of place. We will definately be staying there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Huntington Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very efficient and effective. The room was very pleasant although the sliding door on the bathroom might be a little too modern for my taste. Much quieter than I expected, given the location and the crowd. The large shower space was wonderful. The fact that Happy Hour at the bar runs 3-7pm was very welcome and we were frequent visitors. The location was perfect.
reviews.title: Excellent location right on the Seafront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I came to HB to celebrate our 15th anniversary. Having grown up in southern California, I had many wonderful memories of playing volleyball at HB, and we decided to return. So glad we did. The hotel is a really nice, modern hotel right across the street from the HB pier.
reviews.title: Wish we had stayed longer

reviews.text: This hotel is fesh air in the american big resort type of hotel. Very cool deco, incredible location and amzing room.
reviews.title: great location for a different great hotel
Great hotel - perfect location for surfing, walking on the beach, shoppping
reviews.text: the gym is open 24 hours a day.
Biggest miss is breakfast, no buffet, plus bad service and very expensive.
reviews.title: Gorgeous, fantastic location, and great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In general fantastic hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect fit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time at the hotel. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were comfortable and well-appointed. The surf videos in the lobby make me want to take up surfing...
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

description: The ultimate Southern California beach experience with a contemporary twist. Shorebreak Hotel combines the relaxed, sun-drenched spirit of the Orange County coastline with edgy modern accents. The only hotel located near the iconic intersection of Main Street and Pacific Coast Highway, Shorebreak situates you at the center of eclectic shopping, dining, and entertainment…all within earshot of crashing ocean waves. A singular boutique hotel experience.
